name: Aloe Vera
description: Aloe vera is a very ornamental indoor plant, easy to care for and not demanding at any time during the year.Its leaves are original and elegant, and it is also used for its medicinal properties, especially in the field of cosmetics
light preference: well-lit, Aloe vera requires a good deal of light but doesn’t appreciate direct sunlight which tends to dehydrate the plant
temperature: The temperature of a house or apartment is perfect, because ideal temperatures range from 65 to 70° F (18 to 21° C) all year round.From May to September, you can bring your plant outdoors without any problems, but do bring it back inside in the evening if nights are cold.
watering: Watering in spring and summer - Watering must be moderate but regular, more or less once a week. Best is to water when the surface of the soil has dried out.Don’t wait too long, especially if it is hot, because the plant could suffer from it; Watering in fall and winter - Slowly restrict watering during the dormant state.Wait for the soil to dry off to about an inch deep (a few centimeters) before watering again with lukewarm water. You’ll water again at a normal rhythm in spring, when the plant starts growing again.",
careinfo: Once every 3 years at most, repot your Aloe vera in spring after the blooming.

name: Zanzibar Gem
description: Many are familiar with the survivor plant Zamioculcas zamiifolia – but the Raven ZZ boasts a deep purple-green sheen that blasts the houseplant world up to a whole new level!Non-lethal calcium oxalate crystals occur in all parts of the plant and can be mildly irritating to sensitive skins. Wear gloves if you’re in that situation and need to repot or split your Zamioculcas raven.
avrage height: Height – 1 ½ to 3 feet (45 to 90 cm)
light preference: Exposure – well-lit. Zamioculcas raven will survive in very low light conditions, which makes it suitable for use in the office or even in poorly lit rooms like bathrooms. However, for it to thrive and grow, it helps to put it in a very well-lit place while avoiding direct sunlight.
soil: Soil type – draining soil mix, for it to grow to a full three feet (1 meter), give it a pot that is at least a foot and a half across (45 cm) and deep.
watering: Zamioculcas raven, originating from the African-born Zamioculcas zamiifolia plant, is a flexible plant that can cope well with irregular watering.Watering in summer – Zamioculcas raven thrives when watered a small amount every two weeks. Watering in winter – this dormant phase means the raven ZZ plant only needs water once a month.

name: Rubber Plant
description: The rubber tree or Ficus elastica is a very beautiful indoor plant much liked for its shiny thick leathery leaves.
light preference: Exposure – abundant indirect light, It must be set in a luminous room but cannot be exposed to sunlight.
temperature: It likes temperatures from 60 to 75°F (15 to 25°C).
watering: This tropical plant abhors dry air. It must be provided with as much moisture as is possible to compensate this lack. Water once a week, but wait for the soil to be dry before watering again.

name: Brazilian Jasmine
description: Mandevilla – some species of which are called Dipladenia – are remarkable climbing shrub vines.",
avrage height: Height – 10 feet long or tall (3 meters)
light preference: well-lit,choose a very well-lit space for your flowering vines, but not in direct sunlight behind a window.
temperature: Temperatures of at least 68°F (20°C) are required for this plant to survive.Ideal temperatures are around 68 to 70° F (20 to 21° C) in summer, and 50 to 60°F (10 to 15°C) in winter.",
watering: Water regularly but not too much, to avoid suffocating roots.
careinfo: Care for both Mandevilla and Dipladenia is almost identical. From planting to pruning and including watering, they should give you magnificent flowers in summer!

name: Cyclaman
description: family:"Apocynceae or dogbane
light preference: Exposure – part sun, Cyclamen can’t stand heat. It appreciates cool evenings.
temperature: watering:"Water regularly but not too much, to avoid suffocating roots.
watering: Watering 2 or 3 times a week should be enough.
careinfo: It is recommended to plant cyclamen tubers end of summer or beginning of fall.

name: Poinsettia
description: Poinsettia is one of the cutest indoor plants, often quite remarkable around New Year’s and Christmas.
avrage height: Towards the end of April, cut back stems by about ⅓, they should not be any taller than 4 inches (10 cm).
light preference: Exposure – well-lit. It is recommended to place clay pebbles at the bottom of the pot to facilitate drainage and avoid having the roots linger in water.
temperature: It is perfectly suited to living indoors. The ideal air temperature ranges between 65°F and 68°F (18°C to 20°C).
fertilizer: Don’t add any fertilizer during the blooming phase. Outside this period, start feeding it liquid flower plant fertilizer once a month
watering: It is crucial that you water with water at room temperature or warmer than 70°F (20°C). Cold water can kill it
careinfo: Your plant enters a dormant state. What is called “blooming” for poinsettia is actually a set of red or yellow leaves, because the poinsettia flowers themselves are quite insignificant.

name: Crane Flower
description: Strelitzia is a superb plant that comes from the tropics, boasting simply magnificent flowers and nicely dense leafage.
soil: it requires proper flower plant soil mix.rather moist soil, cool but well drained.
temperature: Strelitzia is sensitive to frost, even light frost below 35°F (2°C) and thus can only be planted directly in the ground in regions with mild enough winters.It normally lives in the warmer regions of the globe that offer rather tropical growing conditions and must be grown in pots and brought indoors in winter if this isn’t the case.
watering: In summer, when the weather is hot, it is important to water your strelitzia often, especially when grown in pots.
careinfo: If it was planted in the ground outdoors, it means your climate will allow for it, and so there isn’t much to do except to protect the plant if ever temperatures drop

name: Zygocactus
description: This is the ideal plant to provide warm colors during the cold season.An abundantly flowering succulent, the Christmas cactus will bloom for six to eight weeks every winter.
light preference: The Christmas cactus is an easy and hardy plant once the proper place for it has been found. It needs a luminous spot, but with neither direct sun nor drafts of wind. In fall, place it at rest, without watering, in a room that only gets natural light, for two months, until flower buds appear.
temperature: The temperature must constantly hover between 60 and 70°F (15 to 20°C), because it doesn’t like heat.
watering: Water once a week during the blooming season, and remove wilted flowers one at a time to boost appearance of new flower buds. When the plant isn’t bearing flowers, wait until the soil is dry before watering anew.
careinfo: Once you’ve found the spot that it seems to like best, keep it there: it doesn’t like being moved around!

name: Golden Barrel Cactus
description: Crassula is an indoor succulent plant family that displays surprising evergreen leafage. It shows up in more and more places for its very trendy ornamental value.
soil: Soil – light, well-drained.The soil must stay rather nutrient-poor, no fertilizer is needed.
temperature: Since cacti are used to temperature going up and down, they can live both in hot stuffy rooms and in cold or cool rooms.
watering: You don’t need to water at all in winter. In summer, water from time to time, but ensure the soil has dried up completely before watering again.
careinfo: don’t overwater!

name: Madagascar Dragon Tree
description: Dracaena marginata, often thought to be a palm tree, is a truly magnificent indoor plant.
avrage height: Height – 3 to 6 ½ feet (1 to 2 meters)
light preference: Exposure – very well-lit, or even full sun
flowering: Soil – soil mix. Growing Dracaena marginata in a pot requires good soil mix that can be amended with ⅓ compost, if you’ve got some at hand.
temperature: Generally speaking, dracaena marginata is intolerant to the cold and will only grow outside in places where the temperature never drops below 63 to 65°F (17 to 18°C), even in winter.
watering: Water as little as you dare because this is a plant that stores water in its leaves.During the blooming, 1 to 2 watering sessions a week, when the soil has dried well.
careinfo: If you live in a house that is quite dark, avoid dracaena because it won’t cope with the low luminosity.

name: Dwarf Umbrella Tree
description: Schefflera is a plant commonly found in houses, apartments and offices. It is appreciated for the beauty of its foliage and its great ease of care.
avrage height: Height – 10 feet (3 meters) indoors, 100 feet (30 meters) in its native environment
light preference: Exposure – bright light but no direct sunlight
watering: Watering is needed when the soil is dry, but not abundantly and preferably with water at room temperature.

name: Rattlesnake Plant
description: Crassula is an indoor succulent plant family that displays surprising evergreen leafage. It shows up in more and more places for its very trendy ornamental value.
light preference: Exposure – well-lit,It requires a lot of sunlight.

name: Gollum Jade
description: The jade tree, which makes a perfect bonsai plant, is a succulent that offers magnificent evergreen leafage. Its ornamental appeal make it one of today’s trendiest plants.
fertilizer: it shows that they need more water.
watering: If you restrict the watering, you’ll force the roots to delve deeper for moisture, thus making them grow.
careinfo: Leaves from succulents are loaded with water. If they start collapsing

name: Chinese Banyan
description: Ficus ginseng is a superb indoor plant that is much liked for its superb root trunk and its very ornamental foliage.
avrage height: Height – 16 to 40 inches (40 to 100 cm), up to you
temperature: Ficus ginseng appreciates the warmth that is customary indoors in apartments and houses, ideally from 60 to 75°F (15 to 25°C).
watering: Watering – moderate

name: Brazil Raintree
description: This amazing plant changes the colors of its flowers in three short days, shifting from violet to white. It also bears beautiful evergreen leafage.
temperature: Indeed, this shrub fears freezing, so you’ll have to set it up over the winter in a room where temperatures don’t drop below around 50°F (10°C).
watering: It is important to water regularly, with lukewarm water. However, don’t water too much, but water regularly all summer long.

name: Amaryllis
description: Amaryllis is a bulbous plant that is truly magnificent when it blooms in fall, or winter indoors.
temperature: rather warm if outdoors
watering: Regular watering and add organic fertilizer upon planting the bulb.

name: Flaming Torch
description: In the?Bromeliaceae?family, the?Vriesea?really stands out. As original, colorful and exotic as its cousins,?Vriesea?is simply an astounding indoor plant.Native to South America, its deep dark green foliage and beautiful orange or red blooming are truly appealing.
watering: Regular but moderate watering is called for because?Vriesea?doesn’t usually require a lot of water.

name: Taliflower
description: Both plants belong to the?Araceae?family, and share surprising bracts that give color to drab interiors.
temperature: It loves heat (ideal temperature range is 55to75°F (12to25°C))
watering: regular watering, twice a week.

name: Green-Tip Forest Lily
description: Native to Central and South America,?amaryllis?counts over 80?hybrid? species with flowers simple or double, large or average-sized, with varied colors.
avrage height: Smaller bulbs will develop one or two stems 12 to 16 inches (30 to 40 cm) tall, while larger bulbs will produce up to five stems more than 20 inches (50 cm) tall.
soil: mix of soil mix and garden soil, with a layer of sand or clay pebbles
temperature: sunlit room where the temperature is mild (70to75°F (21to23°C)), near a radiator eventually.

description: Its leafage is original and elegant and the plant is very resistant, especially to heat. Each variety bestows unique, trendy traits that fashionistas and designers like?Nikki?(photo author, top) can maximize in interior landscaping.
light preference:
Sansevieria requires good light but fears direct sun that would tend to speed the plant’s dehydration.
Too much sun would indeed quickly desiccate the leafage and it would take on a yellow hue for a long time.
temperature: The temperature of a house or apartment is perfect, because ideal temperatures range from 65 to 70° F (18 to 21° C) all year round.
watering: Watering must be moderate but regular, more or less once a week. Best is to water when the surface of the soil has dried out.

name: Trailing Abutilon
description: Abutilons, also called room maples, are very beautiful plants that bloom from spring to fall. Caring for them is easy.
temperature: They cannot withstand temperatures below 23°F (-5°C).
watering: Water in case of extended dry spell and as soon as the soil is dry for potted plants.

name: Angel Wing Begonia
description: Tamaya, also called bamboo begonia and Begonia maculata, is a magnificent indoor plant that offers abundant flowers.
temperature: It must have temperatures of at least 60°F (15°C) all year round.
watering: Tamaya must be watered when the surface of the soil is dry.

name: Corn Plant
description: Dracaena massangeana belongs to the dragon plant family, and its complete scientific name, D. fragrans, hints to its rare amazingly scented blooming.
temperature: Find a more appropriate location for it, it requires minimum temperatures of 65-66°F (18-19°C) and ideally 70 to 72°F (20 to 22°C).
watering: All year long, mist water on the leaves, preferably soft water.

name: Peace Lily
description: You’re the proud owner of a Spathiphyllum and you wish to make this marvelous indoor plant last.
temperature: The plant will do great in a spot that is a bit cooler, where temperatures hover around 60 to 63°F (16 to 17°C).
watering: It must be regular but moderate.

name: Pineapple Tree
description: Ananas comosus is a plant that bears beautiful leaves, but what makes the plant famous is its fruit: the pineapple.
light preference: very well-lit while avoiding direct sun.
temperature: Ananas comosus requires temperatures that hover between 64°F to 75°F (18°C to 24°C) and never drop below 57°F (15°C).
watering: Regular but moderate watering is called for because Ananas comosus doesn’t usually require a lot of water.

name: Christmas Flower
description: Poinsettia, or “Christmas star”, invades garden stores like gremlins when the end-of-year feasts come nigh. It owes this to its colored bracts that surround the flowers. Red bracts are most common, but there are cultivars that are pink, salmon orange, yellow, cream, white, mottled, all with bright green leaves in the background.
temperature: temperature between 60 and 74°F (15 and 23°C)

name: Rose Mallow
description: China roses, also called Chinese hibiscus or Hawaiian hibiscus, are a symbol of everything exotic.
avrage height: 1 ⅓ to 5 feet (0.4 to 1.5 meters) (up to 13 feet (4 meters) in their natural environment)
watering: Watering once or twice a week should be enough.

latinname: Hibiscus syriacus var. syriacus f. albus-plenus
name: Rose of Sharon
description: Indoor hibiscus, also called China roses, offer magnificent flowers over a long period of time.
temperature: a hibiscus cannot survive temperatures below 40°F (5°C)
watering: Watering once or twice a week should be enough.
careinfo: Practically the epitome of a flowering plant, hibiscus is very easy to care for, and the following advice helps ensure that the blooming period lasts as long as possible.

name: Golden Pothos
description: Pothos or scindapsus is a plant native to the tropics with very ornamental leafage.
light preference: Select a luminous spot but without direct sun and stay away from heat sources such as radiators.
temperature: A temperature of 65 to 75°F (18 to 25°C) is recommended for proper growth.
watering: Water the plant only when the surface of the soil is dry, and avoid excess water so as to not suffocate the roots.
careinfo: Pothos is very easy to grow. It requires very little care and resists quite well to the various diseases.

name: Mexican Breadfruit
description: Monstera is among the favorite plants chosen to decorate houses and apartments.
light preference: The best place to set up your monstera is near a window but not direct sunlight.
temperature: Ideal temperatures are around 70°F (20°C).
fertilizer: Add leaf plant liquid fertilizer every 3 to 4 weeks during the growing phase.
watering: Regular but moderate watering is called for.
careinfo: Care, repotting, watering and exposure, are items to focus your attention to make your monstera even nicer.

name: Nosegay
description: Frangipani is a shrub used indoors for its appealing blooming and its great ornamental qualities.
avrage height: 5 feet (1.5 meters) indoors, 32 feet (10 meters) in its natural environment
temperature: Temperatures must never drop below 50°F (5°C).
careinfo: Frangipani is easygoing and requires very little care.Indoors, in an apartment, choose a very sunny location, in direct sunlight for the most part of the day.

name: Benjamin Fig
description: The Ficus forever tree is a magnificent indoor plant and it deserves the greatest care that can be provided.
light preference: bright light but no direct sunlight
watering: Its preferable to wait for the soil to have dried up before watering again.
careinfo: Ficus forever is selective as regards its exposure, its watering and must be guarded against rapid changes in temperature.

name: Natal Lily
description: Clivia is an elegant flower-bearing indoor plant.It makes our houses and apartments look lively with its elevated ornamental impact and its unique flowers.
temperature: Ideal temperatures are around 70°F (20°C).
fertilizer: flower plant liquid fertilizer every 8 to 15 days
watering: Regular but moderate watering is called for.All year long and especially during summer, spray water on the leaves to recreate the moisture levels of its natural habitat.
careinfo: Remove wilted flowers regularly by snipping off the floral scape at the base.

name: Wild Banana Plant
description: As original, colorful and exotic as its cousins are, Aechmea is a simply astounding indoor plant of the vast Bromeliaceae family.Native to Central and South America, one finds its mottled foliage and beautiful pastel red blooming appealing.
temperature: temperatures that oscillate between 65 and 74°F (18 to 24°C)
fertilizer: orchid-specific fertilizer more or less once a month
watering: Watering 1 time a week is often practiced.

name: Tricolor Plant
description: Billbergia is a plant often grown indoors in cooler climates that is simply beautiful.
light preference: Exposure – light but without direct light
flowering: Flowering – end of winter or summer
temperature: Billbergia requires temperatures that oscillate between 65 and 74°F (18 to 24°C) and never drop below 57°F (-13°C).
watering: Regular but moderate watering is called for because Billbergia doesn’t usually require a lot of water.
careinfo: Spraying the plant regularly and placing the pot atop a bed of wet gravel will help re-create the plant’s natural habitat.

name: Chinese Money Plant
description: Pilea peperomioides, also called “Chinese money plant”, is a very ornamental plant which is ideal in designer settings.
temperature: Pilea shouldn’t normally survive temperatures lower than 50°F (10°C) in winter.
careinfo: Pinch the terminal stem (the topmost one) between 2 fingernails to force the plant to start branching out. If you wish for the plant to keep a bushy bearing and grow as many branches as can be, simply keep pinching young shoots off after a bud.

name: Angel Wings Plant
description: A very fragile plant that is difficult to grow, Caladium makes our houses and apartments look lively with its elevated ornamental impact and unique foliage.
avrage height: Height – 36 to 40 inches (0.8 to 1 meter) indoors, 13 feet (4 meters) in its natural habitat
temperature: Ideal temperatures are around 68 to 70° F (20 to 21° C).
watering: Caladium is a greenhouse plant that appreciates heat and moisture. Regular but moderate watering is thus called for.
careinfo: Remove damaged leaves regularly by snipping them off at the base.

name: Chicken Gizzard Plant
description: Peperomia is a tropical plant used indoors and in apartments. It is very much appreciated for its foliage, which is extremely varied depending to the species and in every case amazingly ornamental.
temperature: Temperatures mustn’t drop below 55 to 57°F (12 to 13°C).
watering: Water lightly and only when the soil is really dry.
careinfo: Only eliminate leaves if they’ve withered, dried up or turned yellow

name: Mountain Date Palm
description: Pygmy date palm or Phoenix roebelenii is a palm tree, often grown indoors, that bears thin, elegant green leaves.
temperature: It grows best when surrounding temperatures hold at around 70 to 72°F (20 to 22°C) and requires very good light, even direct sunlight.

name: Peacock Plant
description: Calathea is a magnificent plant native to South America.
avrage height: Height – 36 to 40 inches (0.8 to 1 meter) indoors
temperature: Ideal temperatures are around 70°F (20°C).
careinfo: Remove wilted leaves regularly.

name: Malabar Chestnut Tree
description: Pachira is an incredible indoor plant, with rather modern appeal.
avrage height: Height –32 to 64 feet (10 to 20 m) in its natural environment
temperature: In winter, the plant fares well at the temperature of an unheated lean-in in winter, provided it doesn’t drop below 40°F (5°C).
careinfo: Don’t add any fertilizer during the dormant state from October to March.
